summary: The federal government is the nation's biggest employer, with about 2.1 million non-postal civilian employees. Are those employees properly reporting their hours? We looked at time and attendance misconduct and potential fraud at 24 agencies. Agency inspectors general said they collectively substantiated 100 allegations of employee time and attendance misconduct or fraud from FY 2015-2019. This ranged from 0 to over 10 cases at individual...
title: Time and Attendance: Agencies Generally Compiled Data on Misconduct, and Reported Using Various Internal Controls for Monitoring
